column4: hey guys. quick question: for a 1.6 ghz single core AMD XP with a gig of DDR RAM, is it worth going to xubuntu just for a quick boost of speed? it's fine running ubuntu but can struggle with some websites, esp. if there's quite a few tabs up. (i've read that xubuntu is quicker than ubuntu but actually not THAT much quicker, not as much as they make out anyway)
xubuntu will be more responsive but i've ran a full kde system on a similar rig
thanks, i guess i may as well stick with ubuntu then (it's for my mum and she's more familiar with gnome) :)
cool, if she likes it then stick with it, user interface familiarity an all
use a lighter de like xfce or lxde
i'm assuming lxde and xfce are lighter on harddrive space too? as performance in other areas isn't a problem
yes they are smaller there too. Using less ram will give more to disk cache which should make things nicer. You can also turn down vm.swappiiness so swap is used oonly when needed
i would but I'm ssh'd in from work, no can do
fair enough - I actually thought a bunch of you would be in that situation :P
plus I use openbox so I doubt its relevant to your (most likely) gnome desktop
does it happen as all users?
I actually didn't even think of testing that. i'll do it right now. thanks!
try thinking instead of the snappy remark earlier ;)
duly noted - i'm already feeling ashamed :P
other users have the same problem (including the super key not working). as much as it pains me to say this i might end up reinstalling ubuntu! :(
then it is a bug, not bad settings
in that case i'll definitely file a bug
